sen.j: 応天門の変（おうてんもんのへん）は、平安時代前期の貞観_(日本)8年（866年）に起こった政治事件である。
sen.e: The Otenmon gate Incident was the political affair which happened in 866, in the early Heian Period.
The Otenmon gate Incident was a political incdient which happened in 866, in the early Heian Period.
The "Otenmon no Hen" (the Otenmon gate incident) was a political incident which happened in 866, in the early Heian period.

sen.j: 応天門が放火され、大納言伴善男は左大臣源信_(公卿)の犯行であると告発した。
sen.e: The Otenmon gate was set on fire, and Yoshio TOMONO, the Dainagon (chief councilor of state) who accused a noble Genshin, the Sadaijin (minister of the left), of committing arson.

The Otenmon gate was set on fire, and TOMO no Yoshio, the Dainagon (chief councilor of state), accused a noble MINAMOTO no Makoto, the Sadaijin (minister of the left), of committing arson.

sen.j: しかし、太政大臣藤原良房の進言で無罪となった。
sen.e: However, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, the Taisei Daijin (grand minister of state), counselled this and Genshin was set free.

However, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, the Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state), provided counsel and Genshin was set free.

sen.j: その後、密告があり伴善男父子に嫌疑がかけられ、有罪となり流刑に処された。
sen.e: Later on, Yoshio TOMONO and his son fell under suspicion as the result of a tip from an informant, were convicted and faced banishment.

sen.j: これにより、古代からの名族伴氏（大伴氏）は没落した。
sen.e: This incident brought the notable Tomono clan (the Otomo clan), which had lasted since the ancient times, to ruin.

sen.j: 藤原氏による他氏排斥事件のひとつとされている。
sen.e: This is considered to be one of the affairs in which exclusionary practices were used against other clans by the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 大納言伴善男は左大臣源信と不仲であった。
sen.e: Yoshio TOMONO, the Dainagon (chief councilor of state), was on bad terms with Genshin, the Sadaijin (minister of left).
Yoshio TOMONO, the Dainagon (chief councilor of state), was on bad terms with Genshin, the Sadaijin (minister of the left).
TOMO no Yoshio, the Dainagon (chief councilor of state), was on bad terms with MINAMOTO no Makoto, the Sadaijin (minister of the left).
sen.cmt: 伴善男→TOMO no Yoshioに訂正しました。源信→MINAMOTO no Makotoに訂正しました。

sen.j: 自らは右大臣になることを望んでいたともされる。
sen.e: It is also said Yoshio wanted to become the Udaijin (minister of right), by bringing down Genshin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処藤原良相は、読みが二つあった為、FUJIWARA no Yoshimi(Yoshiau)と両方掲載させて頂いております。

sen.j: 源信を失脚させて空席になった左大臣に右大臣の藤原良相がなった。
sen.e: That would make the Sadaijin position vacant so that Udaijin FUJIWARA no Yoshimi (Yoshiau) could fill the role.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処文脈より、原文は上記の文章が後で、この文章が先でした。原文の方を入れ替えさせていただきました。

sen.j: 864年に伴善男は源信に謀反の噂があると言い立てたが、これは取り上げられなかった。
sen.e: In 864, Yoshio TOMONO tried to make a federal case based on the rumour of rebellion by Genshin, but this did not get taken up.
In 864, Yoshio TOMONO tried to make a federal case based on the rumour of rebellion by Genshin, but this did not get taken up.
In 864, TOMO no Yoshio tried to make a federal case based on the rumour of rebellion by MINAMOTO no Makoto, but this did not get taken up.
sen.cmt: 伴善男→TOMO no Yoshioに訂正しました。源信→MINAMOTO no Makotoに訂正しました。

sen.j: 866年4月28日（貞観8年閏3月10日）、応天門が放火炎上する事件が起こる。
sen.e: In April 28, 866, an incident occurred in which Otenmon gate was lit and destroyed by fire.
In April 28, 866, an incident occurred in which Otenmon gate was set alight and destroyed.
In April 28, 866, an incident occurred in which Otenmon gate was set alight and destroyed.

sen.j: 朝廷は大騒ぎとなり、盛んに加持祈祷を行った。
sen.e: The imperial court was in uproar, and actively carried out incantation and prayers.
The imperial court was in an uproar, and many people performed incantations and prayers.
The Imperial Court was in an uproar, and many people performed incantations and prayers.
sen.cmt: Imperial Court大文字に訂正しました。

sen.j: ほどなく、伴善男は右大臣藤原良相に源信が犯人であると告発する。
sen.e: Soon after, Yoshio TOMONO claimed to Udaijin, FUJIWARA no Yoshimi (Yoshiau) that Genshin was guilty of the crime.
Soon after, Yoshio TOMONO claimed to Udaijin, FUJIWARA no Yoshimi (Yoshiau) that Genshin was the perpetrator of the crime.
Soon after, TOMO no Yoshio claimed to Udaijin, FUJIWARA no Yoshimi that MINAMOTO no Makoto was the perpetrator of the crime.
sen.cmt: 伴善男→TOMO no Yoshioに訂正しました。源信→MINAMOTO no Makotoに訂正しました。(Yoshiau)は削除しました。

sen.j: 応天門は大伴氏（伴氏）が造営したもので、源信が伴氏をのろって火をつけたものだとされた。
sen.e: The Otenmon gate was built by the Otomo clan (the Tomono clan), so he said Genshin cursed on the Tomono clan and lit it.
The Otenmon gate was built by the Otomo clan (the Tomono clan), so he said Genshin cursed the Tomono clan and set fire to it.
The Otenmon gate was built by the Otomo clan (the Tomo clan), so he said MINAMOTO no Makoto cursed the Tomo clan and set fire to it.
sen.cmt: Tomoに訂正しました。源信→MINAMOTO no Makotoに訂正しました。

sen.j: 藤原良相は源信の逮捕を命じて兵を出し、邸を包囲する。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yoshimi (Yoshiau) ordered the arrest of Genshin, and so the army was sent and his house was beseiged.
FUJIWARA no Yoshimi (Yoshiau) ordered the arrest of Genshin, and so soldiers were sent and his house beseiged.
FUJIWARA no Yoshimi ordered the arrest of MINAMOTO no Makoto, and so soldiers were sent and his house besieged.
sen.cmt: (Yoshiau)は削除しました。源信→MINAMOTO no Makotoに訂正しました。besiegedスペル訂正しました。

sen.j: 放火の罪を着せられた左大臣源信家の人々は絶望して大いに嘆き悲しんだ。
sen.e: The members of the house of Genshin the Sadaijin, accused of the arson, were devastated and suffered severe distress.
Members of the house of Genshin, the Sadaijin, who were accused of the crime, were devastated and distressed.
Members of the house of MINAMOTO no Makoto, the Sadaijin, who were accused of the crime, were devastated and distressed.
sen.cmt: 源信→MINAMOTO no Makotoに訂正しました。

sen.j: 参議藤原基経がこれを父の太政大臣藤原良房に告げると、驚いた良房は清和天皇に奏上して源信を弁護した。
sen.e: When FUJIWARA no Mototsune the Sangi (government adviser) mentioned this to his father, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa the Taisei Daijin, the surprised Yoshifusa presented to the Emperor Seiwa and defended Genshin.

When FUJIWARA no Mototsune, the Sangi (government adviser) mentioned this to his father, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, the Taisei Daijin, the surprised Yoshifusa went before the Emperor Seiwa and defended Genshin.

When FUJIWARA no Mototsune, the Sangi (government adviser) mentioned this to his father, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, the Taisei Daijin, the surprised Yoshifusa went before the Emperor Seiwa and defended MINAMOTO no Makoto.
sen.cmt: 太政大臣→Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state)に訂正しました。源信→MINAMOTO no Makotoに訂正しました。

sen.j: 源信は無実となり、邸を包囲していた兵は引き上げた。
sen.e: Genshin was set free, and the army which besieged his house were withdrawn.
Genshin was set free, and the soldiers who had besieged his house were withdrawn.
MINAMOTO no Makoto was set free, and the soldiers who had besieged his house were withdrawn.
sen.cmt: 源信→MINAMOTO no Makotoに訂正しました。

sen.j: 8月3日、備中国権史生の大宅鷹取が応天門の放火の犯人は伴善男とその子伴中庸であると訴え出る。
sen.e: On August 3rd, OYAKE no Takatori, the Gonnosho (the lower class official) of Bicchu Province, appealed that the arsonists of Otenmon gate were Yoshio TOMONO and his son Nakatsune TOMONO.
sen.cmt: 「権史生」の定訳が不明だった為、下級官という意味で訳しました。「権史生」という役柄は、律令制で雑務を行った下級の官「史生」の副官の意味のようです。意味参照は[http://dictionary.goo.ne.jp/leaf/jn/83028/m0u/%E5%8F%B2%E7%94%9F/]
sen.e: On August 3rd, OYAKE no Takatori, the Gonnosho (a lower class official) of Bicchu Province, came forth claiming that the arsonists of Otenmon gate were Yoshio TOMONO and his son Nakatsune TOMONO.

On August 3, OYAKE no Takatori, the Gon no shisho (an assistant doing miscellaneous duties about documents) of Bicchu Province, came forth claiming that the arsonists of Otenmon gate were TOMO no Yoshio and his son TOMO no Nakatsune.
sen.cmt: rd削除。権史生→Gon no shisho (an assistant doing miscellaneous duties about documents) [権史生＝諸官司や諸国の四等官の下（史生＝ししょう）の副官。]伴善男→TOMO no Yoshioに訂正しました。伴中庸→TOMO no Nakatsuneに訂正しました。

sen.j: 鷹取は応天門の前から善男と中庸、雑色の豊清の3人が走り去ったのを見て、その直後に門が炎上したと申し出た。
sen.e: Takatori claimed that he saw Yoshio, Nakatsune and Toyokiyo, the Zasshiki (the lower class official) run away from the front of the Otenmon gate, then the gate went up in flames right after that.
Takatori claimed that he saw Yoshio, Nakatsune, and Toyokiyo, the Zasshiki (a lower class official) run away from the front of the Otenmon gate, which went up in flames directly after.
Takatori claimed that he saw Yoshio, Nakatsune, and Toyokiyo, the Zoshiki (low-level functionary) run away from the front of the Otenmon gate, which went up in flames directly after.

sen.j: 鷹取の子女が善男の従僕生江恒山に殺されたことを恨んでいたと言われる。
sen.e: It is said that Takatori held Yoshio responsible for his children being killed by Yoshio's attendant male servant, IKUE no Tsuneyama.
It is said that Takatori held Yoshio responsible for his children being killed by Yoshio's attendant male servant, IKUE no Tsuneyama.

sen.e: (Another theory is that Takatori blamed Yoshio because Takatori's child argued with a child of Yoshio's treasurer who then punched Takatori's child almost till death.)

sen.j: 天皇は勅を下して伴善男の取調べを命じた。
sen.e: The emperor issued the imperial edict and ordered to investigate Yoshio TOMONO.
The emperor issued an imperial edict and ordered an investigation of Yoshio TOMONO.
The Emperor issued an Imperial edict and ordered an investigation of TOMO no Yoshio.
sen.cmt: Emperor大文字にしました。Imperial大文字にしました。伴善男→TOMO no Yoshioに訂正しました。

sen.j: 伴善男、伴中庸、生江恒山、伴清縄らが捕らえられ厳しく尋問されるが（杖で打ち続けられる拷問を受けていた可能性もあり）、彼らは犯行を認めなかった。
sen.e: Yoshio TOMONO, Nakatsune TOMONO, IKUE no Tsuneyama, Kiyotada TOMONO were arrested and interrogated (possibly tortured by continuous whipping). However, they denied having committed the crime.
Yoshio TOMONO, Nakatsune TOMONO, IKUE no Tsuneyama, and Kiyotada TOMONO were arrested and interrogated (possibly tortured by continuous whipping). However, they denied having committed the crime.
TOMO no Yoshio, TOMO no Nakatsune, IKUE no Tsuneyama, and TOMO no Kiyotada were arrested and interrogated (possibly tortured by continuous whipping), however, they denied having committed the crime.
sen.cmt: 伴善男→TOMO no Yoshioに訂正しました。伴中庸→TOMO no Nakatsuneに訂正しました。伴清縄→TOMO no Kiyotadaに訂正しました。一原文一訳文の原則のため、ピリオドをコンマに訂正しました。However小文字にしました。

sen.j: 9月22日、朝廷は伴善男らを応天門の放火の犯人であると断罪して死罪、罪一等を許されて流罪と決した。
sen.e: On September 22nd, the court found guilty of Yoshio TOMONO and others for the arson of Otenmon gate, and they faced banishment instead of the death penalty or a first degree crime.

On September 22nd, the court found Yoshio TOMONO and others guilty of the arson of the Otenmon gate, and their punishment was banishment, rather than the death penalty or that of a first degree crime.
On September 22, the court found TOMO no Yoshio and others guilty of the arson of the Otenmon gate, and their punishment was banishment, rather than the death penalty or that of a first degree crime.
sen.cmt: nd削除。伴善男→TOMO no Yoshioに訂正しました。

sen.j: 伴善男は伊豆国、伴中庸は隠岐国、紀豊城は安房国、伴秋実は壱岐国、伴清縄は佐渡国に流され、連座した紀夏井らが処分された。
sen.e: Yoshio TOMONO was sent to Izu Province, Nakatsune TOMONO to Oki Province, Toyoki KINO to Awa Province, Akimi TOMONO to Iki Province, Kiyotada TOMONO to Sado Province, and KI no Natsui and others who were implicated were also punished.

Yoshio TOMONO was sent to Izu Province, Nakatsune TOMONO to Oki Province, Toyoki KINO to Awa Province, Akimi TOMONO to Iki Province, Kiyotada TOMONO to Sado Province, and Ki no Natsui and others who were implicated were also punished.

TOMO no Yoshio was sent to Izu Province, TOMO no Nakatsune to Oki Province, KI no Toyoki to Awa Province, TOMO no Akimi to Iki Province, TOMO no Kiyotada to Sado Province, and KI no Natsui and others who were implicated were also punished.
sen.cmt: 伴善男→TOMO no Yoshioに訂正しました。伴中庸→TOMO no Nakatsuneに訂正しました。伴清縄→TOMO no Kiyotadaに訂正しました。紀豊城→KI no Toyokiに訂正しました。伴秋実→TOMO no Akimiに訂正しました。紀夏井→KI no Natsuiに訂正しました。

sen.j: また、この処分から程無く源信・藤原良相の左右両大臣が急死したために藤原良房が朝廷の全権を把握する事になった。
sen.e: Also, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa ended up gaining control over and all authority of the court due to the sudden deaths of both right and left ministers, Genshin and FUJIWARA no Yoshiau (Yoshimi), not long after this disciplinery action,

Also, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa ended up gaining total control over of the court due to the sudden deaths of both the ministers of the right and left, Genshin and FUJIWARA no Yoshiau (Yoshimi), not long after this disciplinary action was carried out.

Also, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa ended up gaining total control over of the court due to the sudden deaths of both the ministers of the right and left, MINAMOTO no Makoto and FUJIWARA no Yoshimi, not long after this disciplinary action was carried out.
sen.cmt: 源信→MINAMOTO no Makotoに訂正しました。Yoshiau削除、（）削除。

sen.j: この事件の処理に当たった藤原良房は、伴氏・紀氏の有力官人を排斥し、事件後には清和天皇の摂政となり藤原氏の勢力を拡大することに成功した。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, who adminstered this incident, ostracized prepotent officials of the Tomono clan and the Ki clan, and succeeded in the expansion of the Fujiwara clan's power by becoming the regent of the Emperor Seiwa after the incident.

FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, who dealt with this incident, ostracized prepotent officials of the Tomono clan and the Ki clan, and succeeded in expanding the Fujiwara clan's power by becoming the regent of the Emperor Seiwa after the incident.

FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, who dealt with this incident, ostracized proponent officials of the Tomo clan and the Ki clan, and succeeded in expanding the Fujiwara clan's power by becoming the regent of the Emperor Seiwa after the incident.
